author: Emily Welker
title: LIVE: Pet Connection: Meet Vixen
text:
LIVE: Pet Connection: Meet Vixen
FARGO — For a kitty with such a sweet heart, it’s kind of ironic two-year-old Vixen was born two Christmases ago with a hole in hers — literally.
Vixen’s mother was about to give birth when she was rescued from a hoarding situation and brought into foster care.
Debra Bartelt of Far North Felines says it was a difficult situation, but the benefit is that the kittens have been handled since their birth, so they’re very comfortable with people, including Vixen.
Veterinarians initially didn’t think she’d make it past two, given her congenital heart defect.
They also didn’t think they could safely spay her because of it.
However, they say that since then, the hole has closed on its own.
That means she doesn’t require any additional medications and has since been spayed.
She’s great with people and very affectionate, although she does not like car rides.
She can also be selective with cats, so slow introductions are a good idea.
If this little girl fills your heart with love, check out her profile, here:
https://www.petfinder.com/cat/vixen-73339191/nd/fargo/far-north-feline-rescue-nd44/
